latestVersion.termsOfAccess:
Project files like raw data, coding guidelines and questionnaires can now be directly downloaded from this site.
Please see also SSD's Farm Household Survey Database (http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/).
latestVersion.dataAccessPlace: All files for this project/study, except for the Project Description, need to be directly downloaded from SSD's Farm Household Survey Database's online link: http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/

fields.value: Development of Technologies to Harness the Productivity Potential of the Salt-affected areas of the Indo-Gangetic, Mekong, and Nile River Basins

dsDescriptionValue.value: The benchmark survey was used to develop a systematic understanding of target environments and the livelihood of people as bases for exploring opportunities for improving water productivity and farmer's livelihood.   A paper was made to model the technical efficiency of the farmers using human capital (education), other socio-economic factors, degree of salinity/sodicity, and technology use, in explaining inefficiency of rice production system in selected districts of India.

keywordValue.value: Socio-demographic, economic (income and employment), and bio-physical characteristics of the farming households.  Agricultural information such as cropping pattern, tenurial arrangement, input-output of rice production, farming practices, constraints in crop production, opportunities to improve farmers' livelihood

fields.value: Subject: Number of Repondents  Type: Sample Size  Notes: India: 2004-05 = 150 households,   2006-07 =  another 50 samples were taken  Iran: 2006-2007 = 50 samples;

value: Faizabad and Sultanpur, Unnao, and Jagatsinghpur districts of India and  Central district of Iran
